_description: Life Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating life insurance pages

data.intro_content: Life insurance provides financial protection for your loved ones. California residents pay an average of $30/month for a $250,000 policy.
data.requirements_content: Life insurance requires a medical exam for most policies. Rates depend on age, health, and lifestyle factors.

cost_factors.description: Medical conditions affect eligibility and rates
Women typically pay less than men

faqs.question: How much life insurance do I need?
faqs.answer: Most experts recommend 10-12 times your annual income to replace your earnings.

faqs.question: What is the difference between term and whole life?
faqs.answer: Term provides coverage for a specific period; whole life provides lifelong coverage with a cash value component.

data.intro_content: New York has strong consumer protections for life insurance. NYC residents pay slightly higher rates due to cost of living.
data.requirements_content: New York requires a 10-day free look period for life insurance policies. Medical exams are standard for coverage over $100,000.

cost_factors.description: Higher coverage amounts needed in NYC

faqs.question: Can I get life insurance without a medical exam?
faqs.answer: Yes, no-exam policies exist but typically have lower coverage limits and higher premiums.
